author: sam-github
message:
doc: describe current HTTP header size limit

Document that the limit was changed from 80KB to 8KB in 186035243.

Fixes: https://github.com/nodejs/node/issues/24693

PR-URL: https://github.com/nodejs/node/pull/24700
Reviewed-By: Matteo Collina <matteo.collina@gmail.com>
Reviewed-By: Vse Mozhet Byt <vsemozhetbyt@gmail.com>

files.patch: @@ -1880,9 +1880,15 @@ Creation of a [`zlib`][] object failed due to incorrect configuration. ### HPE_HEADER_OVERFLOW + Too much HTTP header data was received. In order to protect against malicious or -malconfigured clients, if more than 80KB of HTTP header data is received then +malconfigured clients, if more than 8KB of HTTP header data is received then HTTP parsing will abort without a request or response object being created, and an `Error` with this code will be emitted.
